result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:18 AM Defendant Brian T. Baeten in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Brian T. Baeten.  Prosecuting attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for the State of Wisconsin. Schedule Plea Hearing.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:22 AM Defendant Brian T. Baeten in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Brian T. Baeten.  Prosecuting attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for the State of Wisconsin. More time for negotiations.
Pre trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:13 AM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian T. Baeten in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Brian T. Baeten. Information received.  NG plea entered.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:00 AM Defendant Brian T. Baeten in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Brian T. Baeten. Attorney Edward Daniel Burke Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. PQW received/reviewed by the Court w/ the defendant. Court finds the defendant's waiver to be made freely and voluntarily and accepts the waiver. Court further finds probable cause a felony has been committed and binds the defendant over to the circuit court. Defendant ordered to appear at next hearing. Defendant given NOH in court.
Arraignment scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
9:14 AM Defendant Brian T. Baeten in court with Atty Spansail.  Attorney Edward Daniel Burke Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint reviewed.  PH waive time limits. Present bond cont'd. 
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages. Defendant shall not possess/consume any illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia/controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license/IID. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. Defendant shall immediately report to the Sheriff's Department for fingerprinting and photographing. Cannot be released until he gets an alcohol monitoring bracelet.

2:13 PM Defendant Brian T. Baeten appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Spansail by video for SPD. Attorney Edward Daniel Burke Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Def given complaint, advised of charges, and advised of right to counsel/SPD.  Bond is set. Notice of Hearing given to Deft. in Jail.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
